definition: to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: I wish to produce the secrets of nature and apply them for the happiness of man .
sentences.chinese: 我想揭破大天然的神秘，用来造福人类。

sentences.english: Shimin kneels on the ground and asks for his foster mother's forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 世民知事情已被揭破，忙跪地恳求养母原谅。

sentences.english: I exposed his lies, but he seemed not be ashamed at all.
sentences.chinese: 谎言被我揭破了，但他却一点也不羞愧。

sentences.english: The power of the Holy Spirit through Nathan broke through David's deceit and cover up.
sentences.chinese: 圣灵藉著拿单的话，揭破大卫的诡诈和掩饰。

sentences.english: It was strange that no one pricked the bubble.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的是没有一个人来揭破真面目。

definition: to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
to lay bare (actual facts, secrets etc)/to reveal
to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
to reveal the truth/to spill the beans
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
